words.description: To exist or live; to be present in a place.
Existed or lived; was present in a place (past tense).
Will exist or live; will be present in a place (future tense).
In the act of existing or living; being present in a place (present participle).
Having existed or lived; having been present in a place (past participle).
Would exist or live; would be present in a place (conditional tense).
Exist or live; be present in a place (imperative form).
Exists or lives; is present in a place (present third person singular).
We will exist or live; we will be present in a place (future first person plural).
Let's exist or live; let's be present in a place (present subjunctive).
Was existing or living; was present in a place (past imperfect).
Had existed or lived; had been present in a place (past perfect).
To own, possess, or hold something.
Owned, possessed, or held something (past tense).
Will own, possess, or hold something (future tense).
In the act of owning, possessing, or holding something (present participle).
Having owned, possessed, or held something (past participle).
Would own, possess, or hold something (conditional tense).
Own, possess, or hold something (imperative form).
Owns, possesses, or holds something (present third person singular).
We will own, possess, or hold something (future first person plural).
Let's own, possess, or hold something (present subjunctive).
Was owning, possessing, or holding something (past imperfect).
Had owned, possessed, or held something (past perfect).

Will say something in order to convey information or to express a feeling (future tense).

Having said something in order to convey information or to express a feeling (past participle).

Say something in order to convey information or to express a feeling (imperative form).

We will say something in order to convey information or to express a feeling (future first person plural).
Let's say something in order to convey information or to express a feeling (present subjunctive).
Was saying something in order to convey information or to express a feeling (past imperfect).
Had said something in order to convey information or to express a feeling (past perfect).

Put food into the mouth, chewed, and swallowed it (past tense).
Will put food into the mouth, chew, and swallow it (future tense).
In the act of putting food into the mouth, chewing, and swallowing it (present participle).
Having put food into the mouth, chewed, and swallowed it (past participle).
Would put food into the mouth, chew, and swallow it (conditional tense).
Put food into the mouth, chew, and swallow it (imperative form).
Puts food into the mouth, chews, and swallows it (present third person singular).
We will put food into the mouth, chew, and swallow it (future first person plural).
Let's put food into the mouth, chew, and swallow it (present subjunctive).
Was putting food into the mouth, chewing, and swallowing it (past imperfect).
Had put food into the mouth, chewed, and swallowed it (past perfect).
Move at a speed faster than a walk, never having both or all the feet on the ground at the same time.
Moved at a speed faster than a walk, never having both or all the feet on the ground at the same time (past tense).
Will move at a speed faster than a walk, never having both or all the feet on the ground at the same time (future tense).

Having moved at a speed faster than a walk, never having both or all the feet on the ground at the same time (past participle).
Would move at a speed faster than a walk, never having both or all the feet on the ground at the same time (conditional tense).
Move at a speed faster than a walk, never having both or all the feet on the ground at the same time (imperative form).
Moves at a speed faster than a walk, never having both or all the feet on the ground at the same time (present third person singular).
We will move at a speed faster than a walk, never having both or all the feet on the ground at the same time (future first person plural).

To move or travel; to proceed or advance in a direction.
